abstracts.cdata!:
The Nigerian National Energy Development
            Project outcomes were rated moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was significant and the Bank and
            borrowers performance was satisfactory. The first lesson
            learned in this project is to leverage IDA financing,
            creating scalable islands of excellence.   Secondly, because
            the privatization program is expected to trigger
            dramatically increased investments in distribution
            infrastructure, new operators will look for solutions to the
            same challenges addressed under NEDP. Some of these best
            practices that could be widely replicated in other
            operations include: cluster approach, customized
            specifications (transformers and PPMs), PPM split design,
            stakeholder engagement, project readiness for implementation
            during preparation, flexibility in project design, use Bank
            projects to pilot innovative approaches for service delivery
            and access, and strong sector institutions are important to
            reform sustainability.
